articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Apartment Houses for Scientists of Kim Il Sung Univ.
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Apartment Houses for Scientists of Kim Il Sung Univ.
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the construction site of apartment houses for scientists of Kim Il Sung University.
					 He was accompanied by Choe Thae Bok, Ri Jae Il, Pak Thae Song and Ma Won Chun.
					
					 44 storied and 36 storied modern apartment houses for scientists now under construction near the Ryonghung Intersection of Pyongyang are gifts to be provided by Kim Jong Un to teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 Going round the construction site, he acquainted himself in detail with the progress made in the construction.
					
					 He clarified the issues to be settled in building skyscraping apartment houses, saying that it is nice and stable to see when welfare service facilities are built on the ground floor on the basis of calculation of the height of skyscraping apartment houses.
					
					 He went round flat No. 1 on the second floor of apartment house No. 2.
					
					 He was very pleased that it is very good to see the entrance between corridor and vestibule built in an arch style and decorated with a pillar and they look peculiar. Going round living rooms, kitchen and dining room, he said he liked them as they have been constructed well.
					
					 He learned in detail about the production of furniture for all households. He underscored the need to provide TV sets to scientists moving to new flats.
					
					 A primary attention should be paid to ensuring the quality in the construction of apartment houses of scientists, he said, adding that the flats built at the best level should be provided to the scientists so that they may not require any additional job when moving to them.
					
					 Noting that the teachers who have dedicated their lives to bringing up the rising generation and training talents of the country are patriots and there is nothing to spare for them, he said it is the intention of the party to build more such apartment houses for teachers and researchers in the future.
					
					It is an important work related to the future of the country to take care of every aspect of the living of teachers and researchers, he said, adding when they are provided with nice apartment houses and good living conditions, they can direct all their efforts to educating younger generation and scientific researches without any inconvenience.
					
					 When the country preferentially treats the teachers and researchers including scientists and technicians, they can thoroughly implement the party's idea of attaching importance to science, he said.
					
					 He noted that apartment houses for scientists of Kim Il Sung University would be completed this year and that those for scientists of Kim Chaek University of Technology would be built next year. He said he would also see to it that apartment houses for scientists were built in Phyongsong district where the State Academy of Sciences is situated and a rest home for them was built on the picturesque shores of Yonphung Lake in the future.
					
					 He underscored the need to learn in detail about the conditions of all the universities and provide students with good dormitories.
					
					 Underling the need to unconditionally complete the construction of the apartment houses for scientists of Kim Il Sung University till October 10, the anniversary of the WPK, and provide them to scientists, he expressed expectation and belief that KPA Unit 267 demonstrating its honor as a heroic unit in construction would put the intention of the party into practice.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Congratulates to Kuwaiti PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Congratulates to Kuwaiti PM
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Monday sent a congratulatory message to Jaber Al Mubarak Al Hamad Al Sabah upon his reappointment as prime minister of State of Kuwait.
					 In the message Pak said he is pleased that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries are favorably developing in different fields and wished his Kuwaiti counterpart  greater success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun, DPRK foreign minister, sent a similar message on the same day to Sabah Al Khalid Al Hamad Al Sabah upon his reappointment as deputy prime minister and concurrently foreign minister.

articles.title: KCNA Report on WPK Leadership over Construction of War Museum
articles.content:
KCNA Report on WPK Leadership over Construction of War Museum
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency Tuesday released a report on the wise leadership the Workers' Party of Korea provided for the construction of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum into a world class one. 
					 According to the report, the museum was built at the highest level on the bank of the Pothong River in Pyongyang and opened on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the war victory thanks to the far-sighted idea and leadership of the WPK to glorify the feats the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung performed by winning the victory in the war and the Songun revolutionary feats of the great Generalissimo Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The museum and the area around it turned into the best centre for comprehensive education and a great open-air museum in a matter of just 10 months. This is the proud fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un and patriotic devotion of the service personnel and people of the DPRK who warmly responded to the party's call.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un energetically led the construction of the museum into a great palace telling about the exploits Kim Il Sung performed for the war victory and the Songun revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il and the heroic fighting spirit and feats of the army and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 He issued an order to the Korean People's Army to construct the museum in a new and bold manner and spruce up well the area around it before the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					 He gave field guidance to the construction site 18 times and gave instructions more than a hundred times in a little over one year. 
					
					 This year he visited the construction site 14 times, 7 times in July alone. 
					
					 He saw to it that the exhibition hall showing the Songun revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il, who led the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle to one victory after another was newly built in the museum. 
					
					 Thanks to Kim Jong Un's brilliant wisdom and guidance the museum has become an eternal museum of the leader to convey the exploits the great Generalissimos performed in the history of anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle down through generations. 
					
					 It came to serve as a main center for education in the tradition of war victory showing how could the preceding generations win the victory in the war against the U.S. and its allied forces under the leadership of Kim Il Sung and the WPK,  a center of education in the anti-imperialist, anti-U.S. struggle and a world class museum. 
					
					 The sculpture "Victory" on which the autograph of Kim Jong Un "Respects to the Great Age" is inscribed is standing in front of the magnificent museum covering a vast area. This is fully demonstrating before the world the heroic fighting spirit and work style of Songun Korea, which works a miracle at one go in hearty response to the call of the party.

articles.title: Month of Solidarity with Cuban People Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
Month of Solidarity with Cuban People Observed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- A meeting and film show took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club here on Tuesday on the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					 Present there on invitation were German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.
					
					 Present there were So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, officials concerned and others.
					
					 Speaking at the meeting, So Ho Won said that the first gunfire made by the Cuban revolutionaries and patriots in Moncada under the leadership of Fidel Castro Ruz marked a historic occasion in encouraging the Cuban people in the struggle for freedom and liberation.
					
					 The Cuban people have won victory by following the road of socialism despite the U.S. political and military pressure and moves for stifling Cuba economically and its subversive activities and sabotage, he noted.
					
					 The Korean people will as ever stand in the same trench with the fraternal Cuban people in the just struggle to beat back the U.S. imperialists' moves for aggression and intervention and defend socialism, he added.
					
					 The Cuban ambassador said that the international solidarity activities are of great significance now that the imperialists are becoming all the more pronounced in their counterrevolutionary offensive.
					
					 The friendly relations between the two countries have grown strong in the protracted and rigorous struggle against the U.S. imperialists, the common enemy, and become a model for the world people, he noted.
					
					 He expressed belief that Korean people would always win victory in the struggle to shatter the U.S. moves for stifling the DPRK, defend the sovereignty of the country and achieve national reunification.
					
					 At the end of the meeting its participants watched a Cuban feature film.

articles.title: Scientific, Technological Exhibition in Public Health Opens
articles.content:
Scientific, Technological Exhibition in Public Health Opens
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The 15th national scientific and technical achievements exhibition in the public health field opened at the New Technology and Innovation Hall of the Three-Revolution Exhibition House Tuesday.
					 Exhibits number more than 1,200 in the form of actual object, diorama and multimedia. They were presented by scientists, technicians and officials in the public health field across the country.
					
					 Exhibits are put on show at unit-specific stands according to ultra-modern technology, inventions, technical findings and books to give wide publicity to the latest inventions and new technological achievements and a variety of ultra-modern goods.
					
					 Scientific and technological presentation, offer of technical data and medicinal services will take place to help generalize new diagnoses conducive to clinical practices, medical apparatuses and medicines.
					
					 Attending the opening ceremony were officials, scientists and technicians in the field of public health in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 The exhibition will last till August 19.

articles.title: National Children's Paduk Contest Held
articles.content:
National Children's Paduk Contest Held
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The 2nd National Children's Paduk Contest was held in Hamhung, South Hamgyong Province, from August 7 to 13.
					 The contest brought together dozens of children from across the country. It was divided into individual, team and mixed doubles events. 
					
					 The contest was featured by fast and correct reading of numbers and new playing tactics. It marked a good occasion in developing education of talents and training reserves with special skills.
					
					 Boy Sim Kwon Hyok of Sunam Kindergarten, Sunam District, Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province, and girl Ju Ye Rim of Ryuldong Primary School, Wonsan City, Kangwon Province, placed first in the individual events, boys from North Hamgyong Province and girls from Kangwon Province came first in team events and children of the Pyongyang Paduk Center in mixed doubles events.

articles.title: Fine Art Work Exhibition Opens at Mansudae Art Studio
articles.content:
Fine Art Work Exhibition Opens at Mansudae Art Studio
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- A fine art work exhibition is taking place at the Mansudae Art Studio on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's field guidance to the studio.
					 Displayed in the exhibition hall are more than 300 Korean paintings, oil paintings, graphic paintings, sculptures, Korean jewel powdered paintings, handicrafts and embroideries. They depict the revolutionary feats performed by President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and their noble personality, the service personnel and people working hard to build a thriving nation and beautiful landscapes of the country.
					
					 Also on display are miniatures of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum and the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery guided by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Korean painting "Picturing to Himself Morrow of the Country Which Won in the War " and oil paintings "Long Journey for Songun" and "Sobaek Stream in February" praise the feats the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu performed by leading all the service personnel and people to a brilliant victory.
					
					 Among the works on display are  oil paintings "A Letter of Pledge" and "Eternal Tribute", woodcuts "War Veteran's Recollection" and "Hill on Which Martyrs Lead an Eternal Life", acryl painting "Fireworks for Victory in War" and embroidery "Recollecting Native Place." They depict the feats the heroic soldiers of the Korean People's Army performed by bringing about July 27, the day of victory, under the leadership of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 There are also art works dealing with the fighting spirit and traits of the Korean people creating miracles and innovations in building an economic power, joy and optimism of the Korean people, youth and children leading an abundant and highly civilized life under the care of the socialist homeland and the Juche-based fine art developing day by day.

articles.title: Aspiring after Peace Is DPRK's Consistent Foreign Policy: News Analyst
articles.content:
Aspiring after Peace Is DPRK's Consistent Foreign Policy: News Analyst
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Aspiring after peace is the consistent foreign policy of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and this is an inevitable requirement derived from the character of its socialist system.
					 In the DPRK, where the popular masses are the masters of the state and society and everything serves them, there is no group that is interested in war.
					
					 In the past the Korean people had experienced ravages of war forced upon them by the imperialists.
					
					 The U.S. began attempting to invade Korea early in the 1860s.
					
					 The U.S. ship "General Sherman" sailed up to the estuary of the Taedong River, committing all sorts of plunders.
					
					 In the first half of the 20th century, the Koreans severely suffered from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule for more than 40 years. 
					
					 And, they could not but undergo the three-year war kicked off by the U.S. only five years after Korea's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					 Since then, the DPRK people have constantly been afflicted with the danger of war due to the U.S. anti-DPRK hostile policy, which made them ache for peace more than other nations.
					
					 Therefore, the DPRK has actively worked for defending peace, the desire and aspiration common to mankind.
					
					 The DPRK's effort for building a socialist thriving nation necessarily requires a peaceful situation.
					
					 Talents and creativity can be displayed to the full only under peaceful environment and peace is the precondition for fully ensuring social development.
					
					 Only with peace, the DPRK can successfully press ahead with the building of a thriving nation and guarantee the enjoyable life of its people.
					
					 Consistent and steadfast is the DPRK's foreign policy desirous of peace.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls on Koreans to Turn Out in Efforts to Achieve Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls on Koreans to Turn Out in Efforts to Achieve Reunification
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Now is the time for all Koreans to turn out in a nationwide movement for national reunification irrespective of ideology and social system, deeply aware of their responsibilities before the era and history, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 For the Korean nation, the country's reunification is the most urgent task whose solution brooks no further delay.
					
					 The uniform development of the Korean nation is hindered and all Koreans are suffering unspeakable misfortune and pain owing to the national division which has lasted for several decades.
					
					 The Koreans can never allow the history of tragic national division and the history of disgrace to last any longer. They should reunify the country at an early date and drop the curtain on the history of the national division. 
					
					 Those who love the country and worry about the destiny of the nation should turn out as one in the struggle to reunify the country irrespective of ideology and ism, religious belief and political view, class and stratum.
					
					 Only when the compatriots from all walks of life in the north, the south and abroad pool their efforts and get firmly united to carry on the struggle, can they meet vicious challenge of the anti-reunification forces and achieves the historic cause of the country's reunification.
					
					 The Korean people's history of the movement for national reunification goes to prove that only when the Koreans fulfill their responsibility and role as the driving force for the reunification movement, aware that they are responsible for their destiny and are capable of carving it out, the cause of the country's reunification makes a dynamic advance.

articles.title: Aim of US Interference Disclosed by Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Aim of US Interference Disclosed by Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The U.S. interference in the internal affairs of other countries is a criminal act that can never be justified since it aims at bringing down the governments and social systems of legitimate and sovereign countries.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in an article:
					
					 The U.S. interfered in other countries under the slogans of "promotion of democracy", "guarantee of freedom", "safeguard of human rights" and "anti-terrorism". However, the slogans are nothing but a deception to cover up its sinister intention.
					
					 The U.S. regards it as a legal right to interfere in other countries. In essence, the interference is to topple the governments and social systems of those countries it doesn't favor.
					
					 It deprives other countries of their right to choose their own way and compels them to follow its instructions.
					
					 It is the U.S. ambition to dominate the whole world by changing the social systems of all countries to its taste.
					
					 The U.S. interference has caused serious situation in many countries. Disputes and conflicts have been sparked off, disturbing peace and security.
					
					 The situation demands the anti-imperialist countries maintain the independent stand and build up its own muscle to smash the U.S. interference.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Japanese Vice PM's Remarks on Militarist Idea
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Japanese Vice PM's Remarks on Militarist Idea
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, Taro Aso, vice prime minister and concurrently minister of Finance of Japan, referring to the issue of revising the Constitution, claimed that Japan may revise it just as Nazi Germany revised the Weimar Constitution in secrecy and that visit to Yasukuni Shrine can be done quietly.
					 Aso's remarks are not a gaffe made by a frivolous mandarin but an intentional and poisonous outburst let loose by a guy steeped in the militarist idea to the marrow of his bones, says Minju Joson in a commentary Tuesday.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 What Aso uttered this time is nothing but a revelation of the scenario to revise the Constitution by the way Nazi Germany did and pave the way for visiting Yasukuni Shrine. Finally it is aimed at launching militarist overseas aggression as early as possible on the basis of a war constitution.
					
					 Japan is losing its face in the international arena owing to Aso's remarks. It is censured in different parts of the world including the U.S.
					
					It is a tragedy of   Japan that important posts in its political circles are held by those who are going reckless, seized with militarist hysteria. 
					
					 Japan will never be able to escape worldwide accusation and derision as long as such ghosts as Aso are allowed to strut about in Japan's political arena.

articles.title: Japan's Denial of Sexual Slavery System under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Denial of Sexual Slavery System under Fire
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- A statue of a girl symbolic of the "comfort woman" for the Imperial Japanese Army was erected in Los Angeles, California State in the U.S. recently. The world has accepted the news as a matter of course.
					 But it is only Japan which raised a hue and cry over it. The Japanese Consulate General in Los Angeles expressed "regret" in a statement and the chief Cabinet secretary opened a press conference at which he asserted that the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army should not be taken as a political and diplomatic issue and it is unacceptable. Information official of the Japanese Foreign Ministry Sato expressed "displeasure", arguing that there is no reason for Japan to be subject to criticism as it has made efforts for a solution to the "comfort women" issue through the Asian Peace Fund for Women.
					
					 A commentary of Rodong Sinmun Tuesday ridicules Japan, querying if the Japanese reactionaries are really unaware of the nature of the crime of the sexual slavery committed by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 Japan is intentionally trying to hush up the issue but such a trick will never work, the commentary stresses, adding:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' denial of the crime of the sexual slavery which has been gaining international focus reveals their impudence.
					
					 Crimes concealed will entail a big toll.
					
					 Japan's mean act in disregard of its responsibility for the crime will invite bigger international criticism and censure. It should face up to the situation, sincerely admit the past crimes and opt for settling them.

articles.title: Series of Seismic Activities Occur in S. Korea
articles.content:
Series of Seismic Activities Occur in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- A series of earthquakes hit south Korea, according to MBC and KBS of south Korea.
					 Earthquakes measuring 3.1 and 2.3 on the Richter scale occurred in waters 35 km and 36 km off Ulsan on Monday.
					
					 Earthquakes measuring 2.1 and 3 on the Richter scale also occurred in waters 8 km and 10 km off Uljin County, North Kyongsang Province on Tuesday.

articles.title: Koreans in US Stage Candlelight Actions
articles.content:
Koreans in US Stage Candlelight Actions
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the United States staged candlelight actions in different parts of the U.S. on Aug. 9 in protest against the south Korean Intelligence Service's (IS) illegal interference in the election. 
					 Religionists, students studying in the U.S. and other Koreans held a candlelight rally in Los Angeles. 
					
					 Speakers at the rally declared that the south Korean "president" could not be recognized as the IS's interference in the election was illegal. 
					
					 They accused the south Korean authorities and the "Saenuri Party" of barring not only south Korean media but media of overseas Koreans from covering news about the actions against the illegal acts of the IS. 
					
					 The south Korean political camp is violating democracy, but it can never blow out the candlelight of the people for democracy, they declared. 
					
					 In New York, Koreans of different social standings staged a candlelight demo, shouting slogans demanding probe into the truth behind the IS's interference in the election, punishment of the chief culprit and resignation of the present chief executive of south Korea. They were holding such placards as "Dismantle IS, Park Geun-Hye, step down ", "Park Chung-Hee staged a military coup and Park Geun-Hye carried out an election coup" and "We denounce IS's interference in the election".

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Egypt
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Egypt
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" was brought out in pamphlet by the Nath Publishing House of Egypt on August 6.
					 The speech made by Kim Jong Un at the military parade marking the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung on April 15, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies that the 100-year-long history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proved the immutable truth that the dignity and prosperity of the country and nation are guaranteed by the outstanding leader.
					
					 It indicates the tasks to be fulfilled to exalt the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully carry out the cause of building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Korean People's Day of Victory in War Observed by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Korean People's Day of Victory in War Observed by Foreign Papers
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of various countries featured articles illustrated with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and his photos to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. They each devoted a full page to those articles.
					 The Bulgarian paper Zarava in its July 15-August 15 issue carried an article titled "Kim Il Sung, an invincible commander and outstanding strategist". The article said the Korean people's victory in the war would have been unthinkable without the august name of the President.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 When the U.S. ignited the Korean war, many people in the world expressed concern over the destiny of the DPRK, which was less than two years old.
					
					 But the outcome of the war was quite different from what they expected.
					
					The U.S. myth of invincibility was shattered to smithereens. Its military and technological strength was by no means absolute.
					
					 The Kuwait Times carried an article titled "Independence and President Kim Il Sung" on July 27.
					
					 It said that the President recorded a heroic epic in the history of defending sovereignty by defeating U.S. imperialism, which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world.
					
					 The Indian papers Krishna Aberta and Defence and Humanity on July 26 and 27 carried articles titled "Generalissimo Kim Il Sung", "Peerless strategist", "A world-startling event 60 years ago" and "The battle for liberating Taejon" under the headline "On the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Korean war".

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed in Democratic Congo
 Pyongyang, August 13 (KCNA) -- The National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo made public a statement on Aug. 5 to mark the 16th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's Work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification". 
					 Kim Jong Il in the work formulated the three principles of national reunification, 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo set forth by President Kim Il Sung as the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 These charters helped all Koreans in the north, south and overseas wage a more dynamic struggle for national reunification full of confidence in national reunification and optimism, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The adoption of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration opened a fresh prospect for the reunification of Korea. 
					
					 However, the ruling quarters of south Korea have escalated confrontation and tension with the backing of outside forces, persistently opposed to reunification. 
					
					 We supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea vehemently denounce the moves of the U.S. and south Korean puppet authorities to escalate confrontation. 
					
					 We strongly urge the south Korean authorities to drop the policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen and opt for implementing the three charters for national reunification. 
					
					 The U.S. should not forget the heavy defeat it suffered in the Korean War but withdraw its nuclear weapons and troops from south Korea as early as possible and dismantle the illegal "UN Command" at once.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of supreme leader Kim Jong Un the Korean people will fully implement the last instructions of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for national reunification and surely achieve national unity and reunification of the country.

articles.title: Celebran actos dedicados al mes de solidaridad con pueblo cubano
articles.content:
Celebran actos dedicados al mes de solidaridad con pueblo cubano
Pyongyang, 13 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con motivo del mes de solidaridad con el pueblo cubano, tuvieron lugar el dia 13 en el capitalino Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang el mitin conmemorativo y la muestra de cine. 
					Fueron invitados el embajador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica cubana en Corea. 
					
					Participaron So Ho Won, vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba, y otros funcionarios coreanos. 
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, So Ho Won recordo que el asalto al Cuartel Moncada ejecutado por los revolucionarios y patriotas cubanos bajo la guia del companero Fidel Castro Ruz fue un motivo historico que llamo al pueblo cubano a la lucha por la libertad y la liberacion. 
					
					Dijo que aun en medio de la presion politica, militar y economica y la campana subversiva de EE.UU., el pueblo cubano ha logrado siempre victorias marchando por el camino socialista. 
					
					Apunto que en lo adelante tambien, el pueblo coreano estara en la misma trinchera con el hermano pueblo cubano en la justa lucha por rechazar las maniobras agresivas e intervencionistas de EE.UU. y defender el socialismo. 
					
					El embajador cubano dijo que revisten gran importancia las actividades de solidaridad internacional en estos dias en que se torna mas brutal la ofensiva contrarrevolucionaria de los imperialistas. 
					
					Continuo que las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises se han consolidado en la larga y ardua lucha contra el imperialismo norteamericano, enemigo comun, y sirven de modelo para los pueblos del mundo. 
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que el pueblo coreano lograra siempre victorias en la lucha por frustrar la campana de aplastamiento de EE.UU., defender la soberania nacional y realizar la reunificacion del pais. 
					
					Terminado el mitin, los participantes vieron una pelicula cubana.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela proposito de intervencion de EE.UU. en asuntos internos de otros paises
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela proposito de intervencion de EE.UU. en asuntos internos de otros paises
Pyongyang, 13 de agosto (ACNC) -- La intervencion de Estados Unidos en asuntos internos de otros paises es un injustificable acto criminal.
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este martes y continua.
					
					Los actos intervencionistas de EE.UU. persiguen el objetivo de derrocar los gobiernos y regimenes en los Estados soberanos y legitimos.
					
					La "promocion de democracia", "aseguramiento de libertad", "defensa de DDHH" y "antiterrorismo" y otros carteles vistosos levantados por EE.UU. son una cortina de humo para ocultar el verdadero proposito de sus actos de intervencion.
					
					El imperio considera como su derecho legitimo intervenir en asuntos internos de otros paises. Esto es, en su esencia, una manifestacion del intento de derrocar al gobierno y el regimen de los paises que no le agradan.
					
					Especificamente, a traves de la intervencion, EE.UU. priva a otros paises del derecho a escoger la opcion conveniente y les dicta lo que deben hacer.
					
					Dominar a todo el mundo cambiando a su gusto el regimen social de todos los paises, esto es la ambicion de EE.UU.
					
					Como consecuencia, ocurren en varias regiones del mundo los conflictos y choques y se destruyen la paz y la estabilidad.
					
					La realidad demanda que los paises independientes antiimperialistas frustren tajantemente los actos intervencionistas de EE.UU. estableciendo firmemente la postura independiente y cultivando sus fuerzas.

articles.title: Minju Joson critica disparates de Aso
articles.content:
Minju Joson critica disparates de Aso
Pyongyang, 13 de agosto (ACNC) -- Recientemente, el vicepremier y ministro de Finanzas de Japon, Taro Aso, dijo que hay que seguir en la enmienda de la Constitucion el ejemplo de la Alemania nazis que modifico en secreto la Carta Magna de Weimar y se puede rendir homenaje tambien en silencio en el Santuario Yasukuni.
					El rotativo Minju Joson divulgo el dia 13 un comentario individual condenando que los disparates de Aso no son un error verbal sino la declaracion de quien esta colmado de la idea militarista.
					
					El comentarista senala como sigue:
					
					Las tentativas de modificar la Constitucion siguiendo el ejemplo de la Alemania nazis y abrir las posibilidades de realizar visitas de culto al mencionado santuario, donde se conservan las tablillas mortuorias de criminales de guerra de categoria A, parten de la ambicion de preparar la carta magna de guerra y abrir el camino de agresion militarista a ultramar.
					
					Los disparates de Aso ponen en aprieto a Japon en la escena internacional. En diversas regiones, inclusive hasta Estados Unidos, se produce la avalancha de criticas a Japon.
					
					Es una tragedia de Japon la realidad de que los elementos militaristas ocupan cargos importantes del circulo politico.
					
					Mientras que Aso y otros politiqueros actuan libremente en el circulo politico de Japon, este pais sera criticado y ridiculizado siempre en la arena internacional.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela intento de Japon de encubrir crimenes del pasado
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela intento de Japon de encubrir crimenes del pasado
Pyongyang, 13 de agosto (ACNC) -- Hace poco, se ha levantado en Los Angeles de California, Estados Unidos, la estatua de bronce de una nina que simboliza a las "esclavas sexuales" para el viejo ejercito japones. 
					Cuando todo el mundo lo piensa como natural, Japon se rasga las vestiduras formulando quejas.
					
					El Consulado General de Japon en Los Angeles publico una declaracion expresando "lastima", mientras que el director del secretariado del gabinete dijo en una rueda de prensa que no deben tomar el caso de esclavas sexuales como asunto politico ni diplomatico. 
					
					En tanto, el funcionario de informacion de la cancilleria Sato manifesto el "descontento" disparateando que su pais no tiene motivo de ser criticado porque vino esforzandose por la solucion del caso de esclavas sexuales a traves del "Fondo Asiatico de Paz para las Mujeres". 
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual de este martes, denuncia el gran cinismo de los reaccionarios japoneses que tratan de dejar irresuelto el problema de esclavitud sexual que se torna cada vez mas polemico en la arena internacional.
					
					Si Japon sigue actuando suciamente como ahora sin sentirse responsable por ese caso, no podra eludir las criticas y repudio mas fuertes en la escena internacional, advierte.
					
					Japon debe reconocer con sinceridad sus crimenes del pasado e indemnizarlos justipreciando la realidad, concluye.
